definitions.definition: The ancient Egyptian moon god of wisdom , learning , and magic , usually depicted as an ibis or baboon .

The first month of the later ancient Egyptian civil calendar and Coptic calendar, corresponding to the first month of the season of Akhet . Since 25 BCE , when the calendar was reformed to include leap-days, Thoth has been in roughly September .

main_definition: ( Egyptian mythology ) The ancient Egyptian moon god of wisdom , learning , and magic , usually depicted as an ibis or baboon .
secondary_definitions: The first month of the later ancient Egyptian civil calendar and Coptic calendar, corresponding to the first month of the season of Akhet . Since 25 BCE , when the calendar was reformed to include leap-days, Thoth has been in roughly September .
